pros: very rewarding, flexible, great team work
-Patients and families who truly need care and support -most of the staff actually care about the work they do
cons: Multiple: -Required to work overtime for over a year, with no choice as to when it was assigned -continues to grow and put money into facilities without proper staffing -Lack of support from management ——was told one week I was being promoted and then two weeks later was told how awful I was at my job with examples from several months prior and that I would no longer be able to more forward in the previously offered position -New computer system launched and no support from management during transition

pros: Great training program, nice employees, nice management, great teamwork

cons: Working with sick or dying people can be a challenge.
On call lacks structure, low-average pay
There are no cons to share

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Lexington-Fayette, KY
pros: Meaningful work, opportunity to help patients and families as they go through difficult and emotional times
cons: Work life balance is challenging, lots of turnover

review_title: Truly could not feel more fulfilled than at Bluegrass Care Navigators
pros: BCN has created such an incredible work culture. They are all about work/life balance and taking care of your mental health. I always feel supported and like I can go to my supervisors with concerns at any time. I always feel listened to and respected. I cannot imagine working anywhere else.
cons: Working in hospice can be very difficult (I cannot even imagine for clinical staff). It required a lot of thought out planning and routine setting to make sure that I was taking care of myself when first starting here.

pros: Salary and Benefits are on par. Hospice work is very fulfilling.
cons: Management is not responsive or helpful. Favorite employees treated differently than others. Staff expected to work unlimited hours, often late work days. Heavy staff turnover. Admissions take several hours, required to start admissions up to one hour before end of shift. Last minute requirements to pick up shifts to cover weekends, on-call and holidays because manager forgets to get them covered. Lie to all new hires and tell you 12 patients. Most caseloads are 14-16 and up to 18 patients with admissions.  Rarely have  the flex help as they tell applicants to expect.

pros: Supervisor allows you to do your job.
cons: Being on call even after working day shift.

pros: Kindness is evident throughout from clinical staff to administration
cons: Frequently short staffed and recurring staffing issues

pros: Flexible, small enough to know everyone, a culture that cares about employees
cons: Like every employer, the healthcare packages could be better
Could have a better work-life balance initiative.
